definitions: name or term that wrongly suggests a meaning or connection not actually present
inaccurate or inappropriate label applied to something
examples: Calling it a theory is a complete misnomer
The term 'koala bear' is actually a misnomer
Using 'wireless' for those cables was clearly a misnomer
The name 'Greenland' has always been a famous misnomer

definitions: thick Japanese seasoning paste made from fermented soybeans, salt, and koji
examples: She added white miso to the soup base
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of miso
Traditional miso ramen features a rich, savory broth
Red miso has a stronger flavor than white

definitions: person who dislikes, despises, or is strongly prejudiced against women
examples: The author was criticized for being a misogynist
His comments revealed him to be a complete misogynist
She refused to work with known misogynists
The misogynist attitudes in the workplace were unacceptable

definitions: dislike of, contempt for, or ingrained prejudice against women
examples: The film was criticized for its blatant misogyny
Workplace misogyny remains a serious problem globally
She wrote extensively about internalized misogyny
The novel explores themes of racism and misogyny

definitions: act or instance of reading text incorrectly
incorrect understanding or interpretation of written material or situations
examples: The misreading of the instructions caused major problems
Several misreadings marred the otherwise excellent performance
His misreading of her intentions led to embarrassment
The critic's misreading of the poem sparked debate

definitions: rocket-propelled weapon designed to deliver explosive warheads over long distances
object thrown forcefully at a target
examples: The military launched several cruise missiles overnight
Anti-aircraft missiles protected the strategic installations
Protesters hurled missiles at the police barricade
The vandals used rocks and bottles as missiles

definitions: important task or assignment typically involving travel
organized effort by religious group to spread faith
space flight or expedition with specific objectives
core purpose or goal of an organization
examples: The diplomatic mission to negotiate peace lasted weeks
She accepted the dangerous mission without hesitation
The church established a mission in rural Africa
Catholic missions spread throughout the Americas
The Mars mission will launch next year
All astronauts completed their mission objectives successfully
Our company's mission is to provide affordable healthcare
The mission statement emphasizes customer satisfaction

definitions: person sent on religious mission to promote Christianity in foreign country
conventional face-to-face sexual position
examples: The missionaries built schools and hospitals abroad
Christian missionaries arrived in the region during colonization
They preferred the missionary position for intimacy
The survey asked about preferences beyond missionary

definitions: word spelled incorrectly or the act of spelling something wrong
examples: The document contained several obvious misspellings
Common misspellings include 'recieve' instead of 'receive'
Her misspelling of the client's name was embarrassing
The teacher circled all misspellings in red ink

definitions: stumble or wrong step while walking
error in judgment or action; mistake
examples: A single misstep on the ice sent him tumbling
She recovered quickly from her misstep on stage
The CEO's misstep cost the company millions
Political missteps can end careers overnight

definitions: informal or patronizing term used to address a young woman or girl
examples: Listen here, missy, you need to follow rules
Don't get smart with me, missy
The old man called every young woman 'missy'
She hated being called missy by strangers

definitions: thin fog or cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in atmosphere
fine spray of liquid particles
examples: Morning mist covered the valley completely
The mist made driving conditions extremely dangerous
She applied a fine mist of perfume
The plant needs regular misting with water

definitions: action, decision, or judgment that produces unwanted or unintended result
instance of being wrong in identifying something or someone
examples: Hiring him was clearly a terrible mistake
Everyone makes mistakes when learning something new
The witness made a mistake in identification
It was a case of mistaken identity

definitions: process or action of making an error in judgment or identification
examples: There was no mistaking her anger about the decision
Mistaking symptoms can lead to wrong diagnosis
His mistaking me for someone else was awkward
The constant mistaking of facts undermined his credibility

definitions: parasitic plant with white berries traditionally hung for Christmas kissing customs
examples: They hung mistletoe in every doorway for Christmas
Couples kiss under the mistletoe at holiday parties
Wild mistletoe grows on oak trees here
The mistletoe berries are toxic if eaten

definitions: cruel, unfair, or abusive treatment of person or animal
improper or harmful handling of something
examples: The mistreatment of prisoners violated international law
Animal mistreatment results in serious criminal charges
Years of mistreatment left deep psychological scars
The equipment failed due to repeated mistreatment

definitions: trial rendered invalid through error in proceedings or jury inability to reach verdict
examples: The judge declared a mistrial after jury tampering
Three mistrials preceded the final conviction
The mistrial meant starting the whole process over
Deadlocked juries often result in mistrials

definitions: feeling of doubt, suspicion, or lack of confidence in someone or something
examples: Years of lies created deep mistrust between them
Public mistrust of politicians continues to grow
Her mistrust of strangers kept her isolated
Mistrust between nations hampered peace negotiations

definitions: failure to understand something correctly
disagreement or quarrel arising from misinterpretation
examples: The misunderstanding about meeting times caused chaos
Simple misunderstandings can damage relationships permanently
Their misunderstanding escalated into a major argument
Cultural misunderstandings complicated the business negotiations

definitions: use of something in wrong way or for wrong purpose
improper or corrupt use of authority or resources
examples: Misuse of prescription drugs causes many deaths annually
The misuse of tools damaged expensive equipment
The senator's misuse of campaign funds sparked investigation
Misuse of authority led to his immediate termination

definitions: microscopic arachnid often causing allergies or infesting stored foods
very small amount or creature
examples: Dust mites trigger allergic reactions in millions
The cheese mites actually improve certain varieties
The poor widow gave her last mite
Every little mite of help makes a difference

definitions: joint made between two pieces at an angle, typically 45 degrees
ceremonial headdress worn by bishops and abbots
examples: The carpenter cut perfect miter joints for the frame
Use a miter saw for precise angle cuts
The bishop wore his ornate miter during mass
Ancient miters are displayed in the cathedral museum

definitions: action of reducing severity, seriousness, or painfulness of something
examples: Climate change mitigation requires immediate global action
The lawyer argued for mitigation of the sentence

Flood mitigation measures saved countless homes

definitions: joint made between two pieces at an angle, typically 45 degrees
ceremonial headdress worn by bishops and abbots
examples: The mitre joint created seamless corner connections
He used a mitre box for accurate cuts

Medieval mitres were often heavily jeweled

definitions: padded leather glove used in baseball for catching
fingerless glove or hand covering
examples: The catcher's mitt absorbed the fastball's impact
He broke in his new mitt before the season
She wore oven mitts to handle hot dishes
Boxing mitts are used for training sessions

definitions: glove with single section for four fingers and separate thumb
examples: Children's mittens often have strings to prevent loss
Wool mittens keep hands warmer than gloves
She knitted colorful mittens for winter gifts
His mittens were soaked after the snowball fight

definitions: combination or blend of different things or people
commercially prepared mixture of ingredients
examples: The party had an interesting mix of guests
This mix of spices creates the perfect flavor
Use a cake mix for faster baking results
The trail mix contained nuts and dried fruit

definitions: electric appliance for mixing food ingredients
social event for meeting new people
non-alcoholic beverage mixed with spirits
examples: The stand mixer kneaded bread dough effortlessly

definitions: process of combining different substances or elements

examples: Proper mixing ensures consistent cake batter

definitions: substance made by mixing other substances together without chemical bonding
combination of different things, feelings, or qualities
examples: The mixture of oil and water quickly separated

The album was a mixture of different musical styles

definitions: pattern, phrase, or system designed to help remember information
examples: Medical students use mnemonics to memorize anatomy
The mnemonic 'Roy G. Biv' helps remember rainbow colors
Creating personal mnemonics improves test performance
These mnemonic devices simplify complex information

definitions: long, low sound expressing pain, pleasure, or grief
complaint or grumble about something
examples: The patient's moan indicated severe pain
Moans of pleasure came from the bedroom
His constant moans about work annoyed everyone
Stop your moans and get the job done

definitions: deep, wide ditch surrounding castle or fort, typically filled with water
examples: The castle's moat prevented enemy soldiers from approaching

They drained the moat for archaeological excavation
Medieval moats served both defensive and sewage purposes

definitions: large crowd of people, especially one that is disorderly or violent
organized crime syndicate, especially the Mafia
examples: An angry mob gathered outside the courthouse
The mob destroyed property during the riot

definitions: decorative structure suspended and able to move freely
portable cellular telephone
examples: The baby's mobile spun gently above the crib

definitions: act of organizing or preparing something for action or use
preparation and organization of troops for active service
examples: The mobilisation of volunteers helped flood victims

definitions: ability to move or be moved freely and easily
movement between different social levels or occupations
examples: The accident severely limited her mobility

definitions: act of organizing or preparing something for action or use
preparation and organization of troops for active service
examples: Rapid mobilization of resources saved many lives

definitions: member of organized crime group, especially violent criminal gang
examples: The mobster controlled illegal gambling operations

Real mobsters rarely lived glamorous lives

definitions: soft leather shoe without heel, originally worn by Native Americans

examples: She wore comfortable moccasins around the house

definitions: espresso coffee drink with chocolate flavoring and steamed milk
dark brown color resembling coffee mixed with chocolate
examples: She ordered a large mocha with extra whipped cream

definitions: imitation or replica made for practice or demonstration

examples: The mock trial helped law students practice

definitions: teasing and contemptuous language or behavior directed at someone

definitions: North American bird known for mimicking songs of other birds and sounds
examples: The mockingbird imitated car alarms perfectly

examples: The game mod added new characters and levels

definitions: particular way or method of doing something

profession of working as fashion model
